title: Tyrrell Hatton jokingly blames fiancee after she slams toilet door and distracts him mid-swing
text:
Tyrrell Hatton is known for his on-course temper and when he was forced to back off a shot during the second round of the Italian Open, observers feared for the miscreant who made the loud noise in the gallery, expecting the full Colin Montgomerie treatment.

However, as Hatton was about to embark on a rant, he noticed that the offender emerging from the Portaloo with a slam was none other than his partner, Emily Braisher.

“Is that you?” he shouted. “What are you doing? That’s my fiancee! You put me off – you should be ashamed!”

Contrary to his image between the ropes, Hatton, the Ryder Cup player from Buckinghamshire, is actually one of the most laid-back and self-deprecating characters in the locker room.

“Yeah, it was Emily,” Hatton said with a wide smile. “Apparently, the toilet door was stiff. But it was right on my backswing – I’ve told her the wedding is off!”

Hatton went on to par on that 11th hole on his way to a 69 that took him to five under par, five off the pace set by fellow Englishman Matt Fitzpatrick. A former winner of the Italian Open, this is a big week for Hatton, 27, in Rome.
